bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1953

div1.p: Siler enjoyed reading Hench's report on the Camp Lazear dedication. He is sorry that Streit, who has been in the hospital, could not attend the ceremony. The monthly payment to Blossom Reed has been increased to $100.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1953
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
January 27, 1953
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you so much for your letter of January 20th enclosing a copy of
your notes relative to the dedication of Camp Lazear Memorial Park in Cuba.

General Love had gotten your original copy some time ago and forwarded
it on to me to read. I read it with a great deal of pleasure and interest.
We were awfully sorry that it was impossible for General Streit to get down
to Cuba for the dedication because of the grounding of all planes here. I
also very much regret to say that he has been ill in hospital for the last
two or three weeks and is just today back on duty again. I called him up a
few minutes ago concerning the paragraph in your letter about the wreath.

Mr. Ireland, the treasurer of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, had
sent General Streit the check to cover the cost of the wreath and he tells
me that he is just in receipt of a copy of your notes also and was planning
to acknowledge it to you and send you the $15 for the wreath either today or
tomorrow.

We shall look forward with a great deal of pleasure to seeing prints of
the photographs that you secured.

As you are no doubt aware, the monthly payment to Blossom Reed has been
increased, retroactive from the first of July, 1952, to $100.
With very best regards and good wishes for the New Year ahead of us,

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Walter Reed Memorial
Association
